JProcessing

Class Processing.color

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Color
      • JProcessing.Processing.color
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.Paint, java.awt.Transparency, java.io.Serializable
    Enclosing class:
    Processing

    public static class Processing.color
extends java.awt.Color
    color is the Color Class for JProcessing.

    color is a Subclass of Color with the only Difference being the Constructors. In JProcessing, all Methods Accepts its Superclass color as their Parameters, Leaving the main Purpose of color Class as Providing Compatibility for Processing Codes.

    In Processing IDE, color uses Integer to Store its data. It can be directly Assigned with an Integer in the Format of:
    color c = 0xFFFFFF.

    However, color in JProcessing works quite Differently from their Equivalents in Processing IDE. In JProcessing, Color data is stored in Objects. The only Allowed way to Initialize a new Color is through:
    color c = new color(parameters), or color c = Processing.color(parameters).

    Note that the Constructors of color class will be Unaffected by the present Color Mode (since class color is static), while the Method Processing.color(parameters) will.

    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    Color, color in Processing IDE, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      color(int rgba)
      Creates an sRGB color with specified combined RGBA value consisting of the alpha component in bits 24-31, the red component in bits 16-23, the green component in bits 8-15, and the blue component in bits 0-7.
      color(int rgba, boolean alpha)
      Creates an sRGB color with specified combined RGBA value consisting of the alpha component in bits 24-31, the red component in bits 16-23, the green component in bits 8-15, and the blue component in bits 0-7.
      color(value r, value g, value b)
      Creates an sRGB color with the specified red, green, blue values in the range of 0~255 (inclusive).
      color(value r, value g, value b, value a)
      Creates an sRGB color with the specified red, green, blue, and alpha values in the range of 0~255 (inclusive).

    • Constructor Detail

      • color

        public color(int rgba)
        Creates an sRGB color with specified combined RGBA value consisting of the alpha component in bits 24-31, the red component in bits 16-23, the green component in bits 8-15, and the blue component in bits 0-7.

        The color is set to alpha-enabled. The default alpha value if not being specified is 255.

        Parameters:
        rgba - the combined RGBA color components

      • color

        public color(int rgba,
             boolean alpha)
        Creates an sRGB color with specified combined RGBA value consisting of the alpha component in bits 24-31, the red component in bits 16-23, the green component in bits 8-15, and the blue component in bits 0-7.

        The default alpha value is 255. If alpha is set to false, the color will be always opaque.

        Parameters:
        alpha - true if the color can have alpha value, false otherwise
        rgba - the combined RGBA color components

      • color

        public color(@NotNull
             value r,
             @NotNull
             value g,
             @NotNull
             value b)
        Creates an sRGB color with the specified red, green, blue values in the range of 0~255 (inclusive).

        If any of the color component exceeds 255 or is negative, it will be treated as 255 or 0 respectively.

        Type Parameters:
        value - any type of Number
        Parameters:
        r - the red component
        g - the green component
        b - the blue component

      • color

        public color(@NotNull
             value r,
             @NotNull
             value g,
             @NotNull
             value b,
             @NotNull
             value a)
        Creates an sRGB color with the specified red, green, blue, and alpha values in the range of 0~255 (inclusive).

        If any of the color component exceeds 255 or is negative, it will be treated as 255 or 0 respectively.

        Type Parameters:
        value - any type of Number
        Parameters:
        r - the red component
        g - the green component
        b - the blue component
        a - the alpha component
